content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
─────────────────────
### Extraction System at Position(x=-3.5, y=27.5)
Consists of:
– Burner Inserter located at Position(x=-3.5, y=27.5) with its drop position at Position(x=-3.5, y=28.5)

### Copper Cable Factory Interface near Position(x=2.5, y=17.5)
Consists of:
– Cable Factory Input Chest at Position(x=2.5, y=17.5)
– Primary Burner Inserter placed at Position(x=3.5, y=17.5) using direction RIGHT
– Secondary Burner Inserter (neighbor) at Position(x=2.5, y=16.5)
– Assembling Machine at Position(x=1.5, y=19.5)

### Belt Depot System at Position(x=3.5, y=15.5)
Consists of:
– Wooden Chest (belt depot) at Position(x=3.5, y=15.5)
– Dedicated Transport Belt Segment at Position(x=4.5, y=15.5) adjacent to the depot chest
– Depot Burner Inserter at Position(x=3.5, y=14.5) with pickup position Position(x=3.5, y=15.5) and drop position Position(x=3.5, y=13.5)

### Electricity Generator at Position(x=-0.5, y=24.5)
Consists of:
– Steam Engine at Position(x=-0.5, y=24.5)
– Boiler at Position(x=-5.5, y=24.0)
– Offshore Pump at Position(x=-7.5, y=25.5)

ERROR TIPS
──────────
– When connecting transport belts, the target must be an inserter instead of a steam engine. Verify the target entity type before attempting any belt connection.
– For placement actions, ensure the player is within the maximum allowed distance. In cases where placement fails because the target position is too far (e.g. target distance 15.89 exceeds a max of 10), move closer prior to placing the entity.
– Confirm that the required entity is available in the inventory before attempting a placement; missing inventory items (such as a wooden chest) will cause placement errors.
– Validate all variable references before use. For example, ensure that variables like “target_chest” are properly defined to avoid NameErrors.
